newsitem.title: HONG KONG: East Asia Heller sets HK$300 million loan.
newsitem.headline: East Asia Heller sets HK$300 million loan.

text.p: East Asia Heller's HK$300 million term loan and revolving credit facility has been launched into general syndication, arranger ABN Amro Bank said.
The facility has two tranches. Tranche A is a HK$200 million loan facility and tranche B is a HK$100 million revolving credit.
Both tranches have a final maturity of three years and pay an interest margin of 55 basis points over the Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
Fees are 33 basis points for co-arrangers and 27 basis points for lead managers,
A commitment fee of 25 basis points will also be charged on any daily undrawn balance under tranche B during the availability period.

The borrower is a non-banking financial insitution primarily engaged in asset-based financing, receivables and equipment financing. It had total asssets of around HK$708 million as of December 31, 1996.
Bank of East Asia and Heller International Holdings each have a 50 percent stake in the borrower.
Heller International Holdings is indirectly owned by Fuji Bank of Japan, the arranger said.
The deal is supported by a letter of comfort issued by the two parent companies.
